    • getallcountries

      @RequestMapping(value="/countries", method=GET) public java.util.ArrayList<States> getallcountries()
      management of the route "/countries" that return the dataset
      Returns:
      ArrayList of States

    • datescountry

      @RequestMapping(value="/info", method=POST) public java.util.ArrayList<Nation> datescountry​(@RequestParam(name="Slug") java.lang.String Slug)
      management of the route "/info" that return the dataset of a specific state
      Parameters:
      Slug - is the name of the country entered on Postman
      Returns:
      ArrayList of Nation
      Throws:
      NoCountry - is an exception that works when the user write a country that dosen't exist in our list

    • listcountry

      @RequestMapping(value="/char", method=POST) public java.util.ArrayList<Nation> listcountry​(@RequestParam(name="Letters") java.lang.String Letters)
      management of the filter that return the nation's list that start with a specific char
      Parameters:
      Letters - is the string that the user entered
      Returns:
      ArrayList of Nation

    • valuescountry

      @RequestMapping(value="/period", method=POST) public java.util.ArrayList<Nation> valuescountry​(@RequestParam(name="Slug") java.lang.String Slug, @RequestParam(name="From") java.lang.String From, @RequestParam(name="To") java.lang.String To) throws java.text.ParseException
      management of the filter that return the nation's values in a specific period the period that we can select goes from 2020-04-13 to 2020-05-06 but for the period that goes from 2020-04-29 to 2020-05-03 we haven't the daily report
      Parameters:
      Slug - is the name of the country entered on Postman
      From - first date entered on Postman
      To - second date entered on Postman
      Returns:
      ArrayList of Nation
      Throws:
      java.text.ParseException - that work when the user make mistake in the data writing
      NoDate - is an exception that is triggered when we don't enter a date that belongs to our ranking
      NoCountry - is an exception that works when the user write a country that dosen't exist in our list

    • getstatics

      @RequestMapping(value="/stats", method=POST) public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Number> getstatics​(@RequestParam(name="Slug") java.lang.String Slug, @RequestParam(name="Statics") java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> Statics) throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException, java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
      management of the stats that return max, minimum, media, dev standard, variance of the specific Nation's dates
      Parameters:
      Slug - is the name of the country entered on Postman
      Statics - stats that we wont calculate.
      Returns:
      Hashmap of String and Number
      Throws:
      NoCountry - is an exception that works when the user write a country that dosen't exist in our list.
      java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - exception generate
      java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - exception generate

    • handler

      @ExceptionHandler(Exception_Err.class) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Object> handler​(Exception_Err e)
      Method that triggers an exception on Postman
      Parameters:
      e - exception to handle
      Returns:
      ExceptionManager object
